answers.answer: I can understand your desperation, lenashoe, but rather than grasp at straws more appropriate as a mild supplement to Type 2 treatment with such a seriously out of control Type I I would seek an evaluation with a pediatric endo to see what can be done with your son's insulin management to get his numbers more stable.

question: My son,10, was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes in May of this year.  We have had a terriable time trying to control it.  Yesterday he was 430 in the middle of the night and then woke up with a 33!  We keep a very detailed journal, monitor patterns, watch his carb intake and things just seem to be CRAZY!  I have heard that cinnamon pills can help sustain sugar levels but when I googled it there was only one study done on type 1 kids and there was no significant changes.  I found tons of info on type 2 saying that it helped them but not us!  Has any one tryed this and what were your results?
title: Cinnamon pills and type 1
